intro: Ferulago sartorii, commonly known as the Italian fumitory, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or disturbed soils. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ferulago sartorii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
